items.sentence: Tom has borrowed over 3,000 dollars from Mary.
I\'d like a chance to set the record straight.
I\'d like to ask Tom a few questions if I may.
Get up fifteen minutes earlier in the morning.
The deadline for applications is October 20th.
The discussion was intellectually stimulating.
It\'d be a shame for this food to go to waste.
It\'ll cost at least 2,000 yen to take a taxi.
It\'ll take Tom a couple of hours to get here.
Tom says that he won\'t shake hands with Mary.
Tom and the other passengers got on the plane.
Tom asked Mary if she was planning to do that.
Tom ate half the peach and handed me the rest.
I\'m going to meet Tom at the station at 2:30.
I\'m going to the toy store with the children.
I\'m going to watch the baseball game tonight.
Tom called to say that he\'d be a little late.
Tom can\'t find a babysitter for Friday night.
It\'s not worth the money they\'re asking for.
It\'s obvious that Tom knows what he\'s doing.
